messages.content: What does the ComfyUI-CSV-Loader allow users to do?
The ComfyUI-CSV-Loader allows users to access positive/negative prompts associated with a name from CSV files within the ComfyUI interface for prompt building.
How do I install the ComfyUI-CSV-Loader?
To install the ComfyUI-CSV-Loader, unzip the ComfyUI-CSV-Loader.zip file and place it into the custom_nodes folder within your ComfyUI installation, without changing the naming.
What file can I use to test the ComfyUI-CSV-Loader nodes?
You can use the ComyUI_Simple_Workflow.png file found in the ComfyUI-CSV-Loader folder to test the nodes or add them to your current workflow.
Where is the folder with the CSV files located within the ComfyUI installation?
The folder with the CSV files is located in ComfyUI\custom_nodes\ComfyUI-CSV_Loader\CSV to keep everything contained.
Which CSV files are included in the ComfyUI-CSV-Loader?
The included CSV files are artists.csv, artmovements.csv, characters.csv, composition.csv, lighting.csv, negative.csv, positive.csv, settings.csv, and styles.csv.
Can I update the selections in the CSV files?
Yes, the CSV files included with the ComfyUI-CSV-Loader can be updated with additional content at any time.
Where can I find more information about the ComfyUI-CSV-Loader workflow?
More information about the ComfyUI-CSV-Loader workflow can be found at the following link: https://comfyworkflows.com/?workflow_id=320ac429-28cd-4192-a7c3-da1ed3fd1893
Who is the author of the ComfyUI-CSV-Loader?
The author of the ComfyUI-CSV-Loader is PCMonsterx.
Where can I find the source code for the ComfyUI-CSV-Loader?
The source code for the ComfyUI-CSV-Loader can be found on GitHub at the following link: https://github.com/PCMonsterx/ComfyUI-CSV-Loader
